trends: There have been 17 other sightings in Portland
There were no other sightings in Portland on or around July 8th 1990
divs: Sighting DetailsI believe the year was 1990. It was summer, probably July. About 11PM. I had driven come from work to my parents house in Lebanon, Maine. I looked up at the sky to see if I could find the bigger dipper. While locating it, I saw what I thought was a shooting star. Then another shooting star took off where the last one ended (The light would shoot across the entire sky and then disapear... it looked just like a shooting star... same size, light intensity, shape,speed, apparent distance to the eye, and color). However, it could not be a shooting star because the next one always took off where the last one ended. The pattern was erratic. sometimes it would take off at a 90 degree angle from the last flight path and other times 180 degrees. It zoomed across the entire skyline in a matter of 1 to 2 seconds... amazingly fast... too fast for anything man made and making direction turn that would be impossible at such speeds. After about a dozen or so of these lights across the sky, it took off past the tree line and did not reappear. I stood there stunned for about a half an hour before giving up on seeing it again. My mother's friend, a 70+ year old lady told her about seeing it that same night (I never told my mom ... or anyone... until my Mom mentioned this lady telling her... I thought people would think I was crazy). I have never seen anything like that in my whole life (I was 17 at the time and I am now 36). It was amazing and even with my scientific mind, I cannot explain what it is that I saw that night. I've tried to rationalize it many times and I just can't explain it... but I saw it and it was real.
Summary: Shooting star looking object(s) darting across sky several times.
